alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:59AM EST until December 19 at 10:25AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Saddle River near Lodi affecting Bergen County. For the Saddle River...including Lodi...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saddle River near Lodi. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Boys and Girls Club flooded. Saddle Brook flooding roads near Rochelle Park Swim Club. Flooding across the entire parking lot at the Municipal Building in Rochelle Park. At 8.5 feet, Flooding at Washington Elementary School next to Main Street. Water begins to overflow into the parking lot at Felician College. At 9.0 feet, Building Complex parking lot along Main Street completely flooded. Flooding at Superstar Auto Collision LLC. Flooding at the T-Mobile store and the senior housing complex as well as flooding along Route 46 by John Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Monday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 02/25/1977. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Saddle River Lodi 5.5 8.0 Mon 10 am ES 3.4 2.8 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
